greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = lambda(phi(n)) where lambda(n) (A002322) is the Carmichael lambda function which gives the smallest integer m such that k^m = 1 mod n for all integers k relatively prime to n and phi(n) is A000010.
link: Charles R Greathouse IV, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
results.author: _Joseph L. Pe_, Nov 29 2002
